page.title: 01General Review - Hadleigh
page.content:
The majority of the block is covered by arable farmland with most of the large, ancient farms concentrating on wheat, barley,sugar beet and oil seed rape.
In the south-east corner lies the small village of Layham. Most of the houses lie to the east of the R.Brett on higher ground, and around the road joining Hadleigh to the main A12 road. The old village centre, Hall, church and Post Office, is west of the Brett.
To the north-east is the small market town of Hadleigh (pop.6,000). This is mostly residential but there are a few local industries.
